author: Online
title: Palace: Olympic dream not over
text:
Oct. 05 Featured , FIBA no comments 
The Olympic dream for the Philippine basketball team is not yet over. 
Malacañang is proud of Gilas Pilipinas despite its heartbreaking loss to host China in the FIBA Asia basketball tournament and is still optimistic of its chances to join the Olympics. 
“We join the Filipino people in celebrating Gilas Pilipinas’ silver medal finish in the 2015 FIBA Asia Basketball Championships,” Presidential Spokesman Edwin Lacierda said in a statement. 
“Throughout this tournament, our team displayed the Philippine brand of selfless, creative, passionate basketball, fuelled by the warm and vocal support of Filipinos at home and abroad,” he added. 
Lacierda also congratulated the Gilas Pilipinas’ players and coaches as he commended the team for bringing honor and pride to the nation. 
“Our people have shown the world what it means to be Filipino, and this serves as inspiration for all of us to work even harder in our respective endeavors, fulfill our individual potentials, and secure the national pride we have reclaimed, one success after another, in varying fields,” he said. 
Despite the FIBA setback, the Palace refused to give up the nation’s basketball dream in the upcoming Olympics in Brazil. 
“We encourage all our countrymen to continue their support for our athletes in general, and for Gilas Pilipinas in particular, as they continue to pursue our collective basketball dream of landing a berth in the 2016 Olympics,” Lacierda said. 
China scored a 78-67 victory over the Philippines last Sunday to capture the FIBA Asia championship title and qualify for Rio Olympics. 
Gilas Pilipinas still has a chance to earn a trip to Brazil if it wins one of the Olympic qualifying tournaments next year. (Genalyn Kabiling) Related
